message_1: A transposition cipher is created by shifting each letter of a message 4 places to the right. If the message "MATHISFUN" is encrypted using this cipher, what is the resulting ciphertext?
message_2:
To encrypt the message "MATHISFUN" using a transposition cipher with a shift of 4 places to the right, we will replace each letter with the letter that is 4 positions ahead of it in the alphabet. If we reach the end of the alphabet, we will wrap around to the beginning.

M -> Q
A -> E
T -> X
H -> L
I -> M
S -> W
F -> J
U -> Y
N -> R

So, the resulting ciphertext is "QEXLMJWYR".
